Implementation Guide for testing Medical Devices

title.value: DHIN & SON 2025 connectathon Medical Devices testing

description.value: Implementation Guide for testing Medical Devices

valueMarkdown.value: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

description.value: Bundle profile capturing audit events related to device usage and operations.
A Bundle capturing device-generated data during a patient monitoring session.
A bundle to capture observations generated by a device including device and device metric context.
A Bundle capturing provenance data for device data submission or synchronization.
Bundle for registering a new medical device with associated metadata and manufacturer organization.
A bundle for coordinating the execution of a task on a device including requester, execution info, and the device involved.
An example medication definition for Amoxicillin.
An example AuditEvent recording a practitioner viewing a prescription.
Example DeviceDefinition for a standard clinical chemistry analyzer used in diagnostics.
Example of a medical device - Chemistry Analyzer used in laboratory diagnostics.
An example of a patient's insurance coverage details.

name.value: Example: Communication from Pharmacy to Prescriber

description.value: An example communication sent from a pharmacist to a doctor requesting clarification on a prescription.
An example of a patient's request to check insurance service eligibility.
An example bundle for auditing device events.
An example bundle for a vital signs monitoring session
An example of a device sending observation data with associated metadata.
An example bundle showing provenance for a submitted device record.
An example bundle used to register a blood chemistry analyzer with regulatory authority.
Example bundle for tracking execution of a calibration task on a device.
An example of a laboratory result observation for hemoglobin.
An example of a pharmacist dispensing Amoxicillin 250mg.
An example of an electronic prescription for Amoxicillin.
An example metric from a chemistry analyzer measuring glucose level.
An example diagnostic report for a blood chemistry test
An example of a healthcare facility organization.
An example instance of a Nigerian patient profile
An example of a Nigerian healthcare practitioner.
An example defining the role of a practitioner within a Nigerian healthcare organization.
An example location representing a pharmacy branch.
An example encounter related to an ePrescription event.
An example of provenance capturing the author and timestamp of a prescription.
An example of a scanned discharge summary document reference.
A task representing the assignment to dispense a prescription in an ePrescription workflow.
A profile for logging access and interactions with health data in Nigeria, such as prescriptions or patient records.
A profile for recording formal communication exchanges such as notifications, clarifications, or feedback in health service delivery.
A profile for medical devices such as chemistry analyzers used in diagnostics.
Profile for defining medical devices such as analyzers, monitors, and diagnostic tools used in Nigerian health facilities.
A profile representing a measurement channel or metric produced by a medical device.
A profile representing diagnostic report results in the Nigerian health system.
A profile for referencing external or internal documents such as lab reports, discharge summaries, prescriptions, or scanned forms.
A profile representing patient encounters related to ePrescription.
A profile representing facility locations such as pharmacies, wards, or service points in Nigeria.
A profile for medications prescribed and dispensed in Nigeria.
A profile for recording dispensation of prescribed medications by a pharmacy in Nigeria.
A profile for electronic prescriptions issued by Nigerian healthcare providers.
A profile for representing laboratory result observations.
An organization profile representing healthcare facilities responsible for health services or other types of organizations.
Nigeria Patient Profile
Profile for a Nigerian Practitioner
A profile for defining the role of a practitioner within an organization.
A profile for capturing metadata about creation or modification of health data in Nigeria, especially for audit and signature purposes.
A profile for workflow and task management in ePrescription processing.
A profile capturing a patient's insurance coverage details.
A profile for checking patient's eligibility for insurance services.
This CodeSystem defines ward codes and names mapped to their respective Local Government Areas (LGAs) in Nigeria.

A standardized classification system used to describe the type or level of health facility within a healthcare delivery system, based on the scope of services provided, staffing, infrastructure, and administrative role.
The administrative gender of a person.
Subset of HL7 administrative-gender limited to 'male' and 'female'.
Classification of Nigerian health facilities
The Patient's preferred language for communication.
This CodeSystem defines LGA codes and names mapped to their respective States in Nigeria.
The administrative Local Government Areas where a person or a facility is.
The owner of an Immunization location
This CodeSystem defines Immunization Location Owner.
This CodeSystem defines ward codes and names mapped to their respective States in Nigeria.
The state where a person or a facility is.
The administrative Ward (within an LGA) where a person or a facility is.
This CodeSystem defines codes for major languages spoken across Nigeria.
